headline: Trump Endorses 'Strong' McCarthy Despite Boos at Rally, Sparks MAGA Outrage
author: Andrew Stanton
sentences:

The endorsement comes only one week after McCarthy was booed during a Trump rally in Wyoming, which was held to support Harriet Hageman, who is challenging incumbent Representative Liz Cheney, who voted to impeach the former president, in the GOP primary.

"Trump endorsing Frank Luntz bunk buddy Kevin McCarthy, instead of using his political capital to undermine bad GOP leadership, is a sign that Trump has not learned much after all this time about who is and is not America First," tweeted conservative journalist Pedro L. Gonzalez.

Trump endorsing Frank Luntz bunk buddy Kevin McCarthy, instead of using his political capital to undermine bad GOP leadership, is a sign that Trump has not learned much after all this time about who is and is not America First.

It's his latest endorsement to face scorn from his own supporters in a sign that while he continues to hold considerable influence in the Republican Party, his sway may have limits even among his most enthusiastic supporters.

The squabble did not stop Trump from endorsing McCarthy, however, who praised him as "an outstanding Representative for the people of California" in his endorsement on his social media platform Truth Social Saturday evening.
Following last year's Capitol riot, McCarthy raised concerns that some Trump-supporting lawmakers would incite more violence, and said he planned to recommend for Trump to resign from office.
McCarthy represents a solidly conservative district that is unlikely to become competitive in November, though he has drawn several Republican and Democratic challengers hoping to unseat him.
